docs.title: CubowBot Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the CubowBot Documentation! This guide will help you understand and utilize all the features of CubowBot to enhance your Discord server management and user engagement.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Getting Started
  2. Command List
  3. FAQ

docs.title: Setting Up AI Features in Cubow Bot
docs.text: Cubow is capable of utilizing AI features both directly and within its ticket system. Follow this guide to set up and use these features.

docs.title: 1. Set API Key
docs.text:
First, you need to set up an API key for OpenAI. Follow these steps:

  1. Go to the OpenAI API Keys page.
  2. Generate an API key.
  3. Use the following command to set the API key in Cubow:
/options chatgpt_api_token <your_chatgpt_api_token>

docs.title: 2. Define a Prompt for Tickets
docs.text:
Cubow can respond to tickets using AI, but you need to provide a prompt for it. This prompt guides the AI on how to handle and respond to ticket queries.

Use the following command to set the prompt:

/options chatgpt_prompt <your_chatgpt_prompt>

docs.title: 3. Try ChatGPT and DALL-E
docs.text: Once you have set a valid API key, you can start using the AI features to generate content.

docs.title: Using ChatGPT
docs.text:
Generate text content with ChatGPT:

/chatgpt prompt:<your_prompt_here>

Example:

/chatgpt prompt:Tell me a joke.

docs.title: Using DALL-E
docs.text:
Generate images with DALL-E:

/dall-e prompt:<your_image_prompt_here>

Example:

/dall-e prompt:A futuristic city skyline at sunset.

docs.title: Set API Key
docs.text:
To set your ChatGPT API key, use the following command:

/options chatgpt_api_token <your_chatgpt_api_token>

docs.title: Define a Prompt for Tickets
docs.text:
To set a default prompt for ticket responses, use:

/options chatgpt_prompt <your_chatgpt_prompt>

docs.title: Use AI Commands
docs.text: Once the API key is set, you can use the /chatgpt and /dall-e commands to generate AI content. Make sure your prompts are clear and specific to get the best results.

docs.title: /ping
docs.text: Description: Checks the bot's response time. Usage: /ping

docs.title: /help
docs.text: Description: Displays a list of available commands and their descriptions. Usage: /help

docs.title: /website
docs.text: Description: Provides the link to the official website. Usage: /website

docs.title: /commands
docs.text: Description: Shows a detailed list of all commands. Usage: /commands

docs.title: /serverstats
docs.text: Description: Displays statistics about the server. Usage: /serverstats

docs.title: /ticket create
docs.text: Description: Creates a new ticket. Usage: /ticket create

docs.title: /ticket add
docs.text: Description: Adds a user to the ticket. Usage: /ticket add <@user>

docs.title: /ticket remove
docs.text: Description: Removes a user from the ticket. Usage: /ticket remove <@user>

docs.title: /ticket claim
docs.text: Description: Claims responsibility for the ticket. Usage: /ticket claim

docs.title: /ticket unclaim
docs.text: Description: Unclaims responsibility for the ticket. Usage: /ticket unclaim

docs.title: /ticket close
docs.text: Description: Closes the current ticket. Usage: /ticket close

docs.title: /ticket closerequest
docs.text: Description: Requests to close the current ticket, asking for user confirmation. Usage: /ticket closerequest

docs.title: /ticket reopen
docs.text: Description: Reopens a previously closed ticket. Usage: /ticket reopen

docs.title: /ticket sendpanel
docs.text: Description: Resends the ticket panel. Usage: /ticket sendpanel

docs.title: /ticket transfer
docs.text: Description: Transfers the ticket to another staff member. Usage: /ticket transfer <@user>

docs.title: /ban
docs.text: Description: Bans a user from the server. Usage: /ban <@user>

docs.title: /tempban
docs.text: Description: Temporarily bans a user for a specified time. Usage: /tempban <@user> <hours> <minutes> <seconds>

docs.title: /kick
docs.text: Description: Kicks a user from the server. Usage: /kick <@user>

docs.title: /unban
docs.text: Description: Unbans a user by their ID. Usage: /unban <user_id>

docs.title: /mute
docs.text: Description: Mutes a user for a specified duration. Usage: /mute <@user> [duration in seconds]

docs.title: /unmute
docs.text: Description: Unmutes a user. Usage: /unmute <@user>

docs.title: /timeout
docs.text: Description: Puts a user in timeout for a specified duration. Usage: /timeout <@user> <hours> <minutes> <seconds>

docs.title: /removetimeout
docs.text: Description: Removes timeout from a user. Usage: /removetimeout <@user>

docs.title: /bug
docs.text: Description: Reports a bug with a title and description. Usage: /bug <title> <description>

docs.title: /suggest
docs.text: Description: Suggests a feature with a title and description. Usage: /suggest <title> <description>

docs.title: /creategiveaway
docs.text: Description: Creates a new giveaway. Usage: /creategiveaway <prize> <winners> <duration in seconds> [minutes] [hours] [days]

docs.title: /play
docs.text: Description: Plays a song from a YouTube link or song name. Usage: /play <link or song name>

docs.title: /join
docs.text: Description: Joins a voice channel. Usage: /join

docs.title: /leave
docs.text: Description: Leaves a voice channel. Usage: /leave

docs.title: /chatgpt
docs.text: Description: Interacts with ChatGPT for AI-driven responses. Usage: /chatgpt <prompt>

docs.title: /dall-e
docs.text: Description: Generates an image using Dall-E based on a prompt. Usage: /dall-e <prompt>

docs.title: /avatar
docs.text: Description: Retrieves a user's avatar in various formats. Usage: /avatar <@user>

docs.title: /addemoji
docs.text: Description: Adds an emoji to the server. Usage: /addemoji <name> <image>

docs.title: /removeemoji
docs.text: Description: Removes an emoji from the server. Usage: /removeemoji <emoji>

docs.title: /coinflip
docs.text: Description: Flips a coin. Usage: /coinflip

docs.title: /notificationoptions
docs.text: Description: Configures notification settings for the server. Usage: /notificationoptions <subcommand> <options>

docs.title: /report
docs.text: Description: Reports a user with a reason. Usage: /report <@user> <reason>

docs.title: /lockdownchannel
docs.text: Description: Locks down a specific channel for a specified duration. Usage: /lockdownchannel <minutes>

docs.title: /lockdownserver
docs.text: Description: Locks down the entire server for a specified duration. Usage: /lockdownserver <minutes>

docs.title: /textchannel sendpanel
docs.text: Description: Sends the control panel for temporary text channels. Usage: /textchannel sendpanel <channel> <category ID>

docs.title: /textchannel create
docs.text: Description: Creates a temporary text channel. Usage: /textchannel create

docs.title: /textchannel add
docs.text: Description: Adds a member to the temporary text channel. Usage: /textchannel add <@user>

docs.title: /textchannel remove
docs.text: Description: Removes a member from the temporary text channel. Usage: /textchannel remove <@user>

docs.title: /textchannel rename
docs.text: Description: Renames the temporary text channel. Usage: /textchannel rename <name>

docs.title: /textchannel delete
docs.text: Description: Deletes the temporary text channel. Usage: /textchannel delete

docs.title: What is CubowBot?
docs.text: CubowBot is an all-in-one Discord bot designed to enhance server management and user engagement. It offers a wide range of commands for moderation, ticketing, music playback, AI interactions, and more.

docs.title: How do I invite CubowBot to my server?
docs.text: You can invite CubowBot to your server using the following Invite Link.

docs.title: Where can I see the Development of Cubow?
docs.text: You can track out progress under Tickets

docs.title: How do I translate Cubow
docs.text: You can help translating Cubow here Translation

docs.title: What is the prefix for CubowBot?
docs.text: CubowBot uses slash commands, so you can interact with it using the / prefix.

docs.title: Where can I get support for CubowBot?
docs.text: For support, you can join our Support Server. Our community and support team will be happy to help you with any issues or questions.

docs.title: How can I provide feedback or report an issue?
docs.text:
You can provide feedback or report issues directly in our Support Server or using the /bug and /suggest commands in your server.

This FAQ covers the most common questions about CubowBot. If you have any other questions, feel free to reach out to us in the support server.

docs.title: Getting Started with CubowBot
docs.text: Welcome to CubowBot! This guide will help you get started with setting up CubowBot in your Discord server. Follow the steps below to configure CubowBot and make the most out of its features.

docs.title: Step 1: Inviting CubowBot to Your Server
docs.text: First, you'll need to invite CubowBot to your Discord server. Use the following Invite Link to add CubowBot to your server.

docs.title: Step 2: Initial Setup (Coming Soon)
docs.text: /setup is a simple command that will walk you through the basic setup. However, this feature is currently under development. In the meantime, you can manually configure CubowBot using the commands listed below.

docs.title: Step 3: Configuring Server Options
docs.text: CubowBot provides a variety of options to customize its behavior to suit your server's needs. Use the following commands to set up these options:

docs.title: General Options
docs.text:
• Set Language: Configure the language for CubowBot. /options language <language_code>

  • Set Rules: Configure the rules to be displayed in the rules channel. /options rules <rules_text>

  • Enable/Disable Automod: Turn automatic moderation on or off. /options automod <true/false>

  • Set Rule Channel: Specify the channel where rules should be posted. /options rule_channel <#channel>

  • Set Welcome Channel: Specify the channel for welcome messages. /options welcome_channel <#channel>

  • Set Welcome Message: Customize the welcome message for new members. /options welcome_message <message_text>

  • Set Goodbye Channel: Specify the channel for goodbye messages. /options goodbye_channel <#channel>

  • Set Goodbye Message: Customize the goodbye message for departing members. /options goodbye_message <message_text>

docs.title: Social Media Links
docs.text:
• Set Website Link: Provide your website URL. /options website <website_url>

  • Set Discord Link: Provide a link to your Discord server. /options discord <discord_url>

  • Set Twitter Link: Provide your Twitter profile URL. /options twitter <twitter_url>

  • Set Instagram Link: Provide your Instagram profile URL. /options instagram <instagram_url>

  • Set Facebook Link: Provide your Facebook profile URL. /options facebook <facebook_url>

  • Set YouTube Link: Provide your YouTube channel URL. /options youtube <youtube_url>

  • Set Twitch Link: Provide your Twitch channel URL. /options twitch <twitch_url>

docs.title: Role Settings
docs.text:
• Set Mute Role: Specify the role to be used for muting members. /options mute_role <@role>

  • Set Join Auto-role: Assign a role automatically when a user joins the server. /options join_autorole <@role>

  • Set Moderation Roles: Define the roles that have moderation permissions. /options moderation_roles <@role1>, <@role2>, ...

docs.title: AI and ChatGPT Settings
docs.text:
• Set ChatGPT Permissions: Define who can use ChatGPT commands (ALL/ADMIN/OWNER). /options chatgpt_permissions <ALL/ADMIN/OWNER>

  • Set ChatGPT API Token: Provide your ChatGPT API token. /options chatgpt_api_token <api_token>

  • Set ChatGPT Prompt: Set the default prompt for ChatGPT interactions. /options chatgpt_prompt <prompt_text>

docs.title: Ticket System Configuration
docs.text:
• Set Ticket Channel: Specify the channel for the ticket panel. /ticketoptions ticket_channel <#channel>

  • Set Ticket Category: Define the category where tickets will be created. /ticketoptions ticket_category <category_name>

  • Set Transcript Channel: Specify the channel where ticket transcripts will be sent. /ticketoptions transcript_channel <#channel>

  • Set Ticket Title: Customize the title for tickets. /ticketoptions ticket_title <title_text>

  • Set Ticket Description: Customize the description for tickets. /ticketoptions ticket_description <description_text>

  • Set Ticket Name: Define the naming convention for ticket channels. /ticketoptions ticket_name <name_text>

  • Set Ticket Q&A: Provide a Q&A text to assist with ticket issues. /ticketoptions ticket_q_and_a <q&a_text>

  • Set Ticket View Role Permissions: Define which roles can view tickets. /ticketoptions ticket_view_role_permission <@role1>, <@role2>, ...

  • Set Ticket Send Role Permissions: Define which roles can send messages in tickets. /ticketoptions ticket_send_role_permission <@role1>, <@role2>, ...

  • Set Ticket Mention Role: Specify roles to be mentioned in new tickets. /ticketoptions ticket_mention_role <@role1>, <@role2>, ...

docs.title: Notification Configuration
docs.text:
• Set Moderation Notification Channel: Specify the channel for moderation notifications. /notificationoptions moderation_notification_channel <#channel>

  • Set Report Notification Channel: Specify the channel for report notifications. /notificationoptions report_notification_channel <#channel>

  • Set Live Notification Channel (Twitch): Specify the channel for Twitch live notifications. /notificationoptions live_notification_channel <#channel>

  • Set Offline Notification Channel (Twitch): Specify the channel for Twitch offline notifications. /notificationoptions offline_notification_channel <#channel>

docs.title: Step 4: Explore CubowBot's Features
docs.text: Once you have configured the basic settings, explore CubowBot's extensive feature set. Use /help to see a list of available commands and start interacting with the bot to see how it can enhance your server.

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
If you have any questions or need further assistance, join our Support Server. Our community and support team are here to help you get the most out of CubowBot.

Enjoy using CubowBot and make your Discord server more engaging and manageable!

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The CubowBot Ticket System allows users to submit support requests or other inquiries in a structured and organized manner. The system supports the creation, management, and closure of tickets, as well as communication between members and moderators.

docs.title: Main Components and Functions
docs.text: The main class for managing tickets. It includes functionality for creating, editing, and closing tickets, managing permissions, and sending notifications.

docs.title: Ticket Creation
docs.text: The system enables the creation of a ticket by checking the user's permissions and, if authorized, generating a new ticket channel with the appropriate settings and roles. A button can be used to trigger this process.

docs.title: Dashboard Panel
docs.text: A dashboard panel for ticket creation can be sent to a predefined channel, allowing users to easily create new tickets.

docs.title: Adding and Removing Members
docs.text: Moderators can add members to an existing ticket, granting them access to the ticket channel. They can also remove members from the ticket, revoking their access.

docs.title: Ticket Closure
docs.text: Tickets can be closed by the creator or a moderator. The system confirms the closure, archives the ticket, and notifies the relevant parties. Closure requests can be made, and confirmations are handled through user interaction.

docs.title: Claiming and Unclaiming Tickets
docs.text: Moderators can take responsibility for a ticket, assigning it to themselves and updating permissions. They can also release responsibility, making the ticket available for others to claim.

docs.title: Transferring Tickets
docs.text: Responsibility for a ticket can be transferred from one member to another, updating permissions accordingly.

docs.title: Transcript Creation
docs.text: When a ticket is closed, the system creates a transcript of all messages in the ticket channel. This transcript is sent to a defined transcript channel, ensuring that records of the conversation are maintained.

docs.title: Creating a Ticket
docs.text: A user clicks on the "Create Ticket" button. The system checks permissions and, if successful, creates a new ticket channel with appropriate settings.

docs.title: Adding a Member
docs.text: Moderators can use the system to add a member to an existing ticket, giving them access to the channel.

docs.title: Closing a Ticket
docs.text: To close a ticket, a confirmation process is initiated. Once confirmed, the ticket is archived, and a transcript is created.

docs.title: Claiming a Ticket
docs.text: Moderators can claim a ticket to take responsibility for it. The ticket is then assigned to them, and the necessary permissions are updated.

docs.title: Transcript Creation
docs.text:
Upon ticket closure, a complete transcript of the ticket channel's messages is generated and sent to a predefined transcript channel.

This documentation provides an overview of the main functions of the Ticket System in CubowBot and their implementation. For detailed information and specific use cases, the code should be examined directly.
